intro: Psychotria campyloneuroides, commonly known as the "Crimson Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife. Psychotria campyloneuroides is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
